skill.description: Interactive user prompts: text, password, confirmation, selection, autocomplete, and forms.
skill.content:
# ASCIIColors Questionary
Interactive, beautiful command-line prompts. Drop-in replacement for the `questionary` library.
```python from ascii_colors import questionary # Or: from ascii_colors.questionary_compat import text, password, confirm, select, checkbox, autocomplete, form ```
---
## Basic Prompts
### Text Input
```python from ascii_colors import questionary
# Simple name = questionary.text("What's your name?").ask()
# With default name = questionary.text( "What's your name?", default="Anonymous" ).ask()
# Multiline description = questionary.text( "Enter description (Ctrl+D to finish):", multiline=True ).ask()
# With validation def validate_email(text): return "@" in text and "." in text.split("@")[1]
email = questionary.text( "Enter email:", validate=validate_email ).ask() ```
### Password Input
```python # Hidden input password = questionary.password("Enter password:").ask()
# With confirmation (enter twice) password = questionary.password( "Set password:", confirm=True, confirm_message="Confirm password:" ).ask() ```
### Confirmation (Yes/No)
```python if questionary.confirm("Do you want to continue?").ask(): proceed()
# With default proceed = questionary.confirm( "Proceed with installation?", default=True ).ask()
# styled if questionary.confirm( "Delete all data?", default=False # Uses default ASCIIColors styling ).ask(): wipe_data() ```
---
## Selection Prompts
### Single Select
```python # Simple list color = questionary.select( "Favorite color?", choices=["Red", "Green", "Blue", "Yellow"] ).ask()
# With values (display name → return value) format_choice = questionary.select( "Export format:", choices=[ {"name": "JSON (recommended)", "value": "json"}, {"name": "YAML", "value": "yaml"}, {"name": "XML (legacy)", "value": "xml", "disabled": True} ], default="json" # Display name or value ).ask() # Returns: "json", "yaml", or "xml"
# With search/filtering country = questionary.select( "Select country:", choices=["United States", "United Kingdom", ...], # Long list use_search=True # Type to filter ).ask() ```
### Multi-Select (Checkbox)
```python # Simple features = questionary.checkbox( "Select features:", choices=["Auth", "Logging", "Cache", "WebSocket"] ).ask() # Returns: ["Auth", "Cache"] etc.
# Pre-selected defaults features = questionary.checkbox( "Select toppings:", choices=[ {"name": "Cheese", "value": "cheese", "checked": True}, {"name": "Pepperoni", "value": "pepperoni"}, {"name": "Mushrooms", "value": "mushrooms"}, {"name": "Anchovies", "value": "anchovies", "disabled": True} ] ).ask()
# Minimum selection required = questionary.checkbox( "Select at least one category:", choices=["A", "B", "C"], min_selected=1 ).ask() ```
---
## Autocomplete
Search-as-you-type with fuzzy matching.
```python city = questionary.autocomplete( "Enter city:", choices=[ "New York", "Los Angeles", "Chicago", "Houston", "Boston", "Seattle", "Denver", "Atlanta", "Miami", "San Francisco", "New Orleans", "New Haven", "Las Vegas" ], ignore_case=True, # Case-insensitive matching match_middle=True, # "geles" matches "Los Angeles" max_suggestions=5 # Show max 5 suggestions ).ask() ```
---
## Forms (Sequential Questions)
Chain multiple prompts into a single flow.
```python user_info = questionary.form( questionary.text("First name"), questionary.text("Last name"), questionary.password("Password", confirm=True), questionary.confirm("Subscribe to newsletter?", default=False) ).ask()
# Returns: # { # "First name": "...", # "Last name": "...", # "Password": "...", # "Subscribe to newsletter?": True/False # } ```
### Conditional Skipping
```python # Ask follow-up only if condition met is_company = questionary.confirm("Is this a company account?").ask()
company_name = questionary.text( "Company name:" ).skip_if(not is_company, default="N/A").ask() ```
---
## Advanced Validation
### Using Validator Class
```python from ascii_colors.questionary_compat import Validator, ValidationError
class NonEmptyValidator(Validator): def validate(self, document): if not document.text.strip(): raise ValidationError( message="Please enter a value", cursor_position=len(document.text) )
value = questionary.text( "Required field:", validate=NonEmptyValidator() ).ask() ```
### Complex Validation
```python import re
class StrongPasswordValidator(Validator): def validate(self, document): text = document.text errors = []
if len(text) < 12: errors.append("at least 12 characters") if not re.search(r'[A-Z]', text): errors.append("uppercase letter") if not re.search(r'[a-z]', text): errors.append("lowercase letter") if not re.search(r'\d', text): errors.append("digit") if not re.search(r'[!@#$%^&*]', text): errors.append("special character")
if errors: raise ValidationError( message=f"Password must contain: {', '.join(errors)}" )
password = questionary.password( "Create strong password:", validate=StrongPasswordValidator() ).ask() ```
---
## Complete CLI Wizard Example
```python from ascii_colors import questionary, ASCIIColors
def setup_project(): """Interactive project configuration wizard."""
ASCIIColors.green("=== Project Setup Wizard ===")
# Basic info config = questionary.form( questionary.text("Project name:", validate=lambda x: len(x) > 0), questionary.text("Description:", multiline=True), questionary.select( "Project type:", choices=["Web App", "API", "CLI Tool", "Library", "Data Pipeline"] ) ).ask()
# Technology stack stack = questionary.checkbox( "Select technologies:", choices=[ {"name": "Python", "value": "python", "checked": True}, {"name": "TypeScript", "value": "typescript"}, {"name": "PostgreSQL", "value": "postgres"}, {"name": "Redis", "value": "redis"}, {"name": "Docker", "value": "docker", "checked": True}, {"name": "Kubernetes", "value": "k8s"}, ] ).ask()
# Deployment deploy = questionary.select( "Deployment target:", choices=[ {"name": "AWS", "value": "aws"}, {"name": "Google Cloud", "value": "gcp"}, {"name": "Azure", "value": "azure"}, {"name": "Self-hosted", "value": "self"}, {"name": "None (local only)", "value": "none"}, ] ).ask()
# Confirm if not questionary.confirm("Create project with these settings?", default=True).ask(): ASCIIColors.yellow("Setup cancelled.") return None
# Final options init_git = questionary.confirm("Initialize git repository?", default=True).ask()
return { **config, "stack": stack, "deployment": deploy, "init_git": init_git }
# Run config = setup_project() if config: ASCIIColors.green(f"✓ Project '{config['Project name']}' configured!") print(f" Stack: {', '.join(config['stack'])}") ```
